title: Print: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog
question:
Challenge:
Print the sentence:
"The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog".

title: Print On The Same Line
question:
Challenge:
Print the sentence:
"Hello World!Python is cool!" in the same line with two print statements,

title: Odd or Even
question:
Challenge:
Given an integer input, print out whether the integer is odd or even.

title: Determine leap year
question:
Challenge:
Check if the given year is a leap year or an average year.

title: Find next number of given sequence
question:
Challenge:
The requirements for a fill-in-the-blank exercise are: the first four items of the known sequence are filled in and the fifth item is to be filled out. This series can only be arithmetic or geometric series, she decided to write a program to complete these exercises.

title: Print all numbers not divisible by 7
question:
Challenge:
Print all the numbers before a given number that are not divisible by 7.

title: Count number that are 3k, 3k+1 and 3k+2
question:
Challenge:
 Given n numbers, please output how many numbers are 3k, 3k+1, 3k+2.

title: Fortune Telling
question:
Challenge:
An Astrologer want to use his computer to make predictions.
To perform his predictions he asks people to enter their Date and Month of birth(DD MM)
The then uses the following formula:
S=(M*2+D)%3
According to the value of S, from 0 to 2 are given three different fortunes: normal, lucky, and great luck.

title: Print natural numbers
question:
Challenge:
Print First 10 natural numbers using while loop only.

title: Palindrome Number
question:
Challenge:
Check if a given number is a palindrome or not.

title: Binary Strings
question:
Challenge:
Given two binary strings, add and return the result as string.

title: Happy Number
question:
Challenge:
Check if a number is a Happy Number.
Starting with any positive integer, replace the number by the sum of the squares of its digits.
Repeat the process until the number equals 1 (where it will stay), or it loops endlessly in a cycle which does not include 1
Those numbers for which this process ends in 1 are happy
 Return True or False

title: Count total digit
question:
Challenge:
Write a program to count digits in an integer.

title: FizzBuzz
question:
Challenge:
 Given an integer n, return a string array answer (1-indexed) where:
answer[i] == 'FizzBuzz' if i is divisible by 3 and 5.
answer[i] == 'Fizz' if i is divisible by 3.
answer[i] == 'Buzz' if i is divisible by 5.
answer[i] == i if non of the above conditions are true.

title: Power of Two
question:
Challenge:
Check if a number is a power of Two

title: Count Primes
question:
Challenge:
Given an integer n, return the number of prime numbers that are strictly less than n.

title: Move Primes
question:
Challenge:
Given an integer array nums, move all 0's to the end of it while maintaining the relative order of the non-zero elements.

title: Greatest Common Devisor
question:
Challenge:
Given two integers, ask for their greatest common factor.

title: Verify alien dictionary
question:
Challenge:
In an alien language, surprisingly, they also use English lowercase letters, but possibly in a different order. The order of the alphabet is some permutation of lowercase letters.
Given a sequence of words written in the alien language, and the order of the alphabet, return true if and only if the given words are sorted lexicographically in this alien language.

title: Rotate elements in a list
question:
Challenge:
Given an unsorted array arr[] of size N, rotate it by D elements (clockwise).

title: Maximum subarray
question:
Challenge:
Given an integer array nums, find the contiguous subarray (containing at least one number) which has the largest sum and return its sum.

title: Plus one
question:
Challenge:
You are given a large integer represented as an integer array digits, where each digits[i] is the ith digit of the integer. The digits are ordered from most significant to least significant in left-to-right order. The large integer does not contain any leading 0's.

title: Majority Element
question:
Challenge:
Given an array nums of size n, return the majority element.
The majority element is the element that appears more than âŒŠn / 2âŒ‹ times. You may assume that the majority element always exists in the array.

title: Single Number
question:
Challenge:
Given a non-empty array of integers nums, every element appears twice except for one. Find that single one.
You must implement a solution with a linear runtime complexity and use only constant extra space.

title: Contains Duplicate
question:
Challenge:
Given an integer array nums, return true if any value appears at least twice in the array, and return false if every element is distinct.

title: Two Sum
question:
Challenge:
See if two nums in array adds up to target.

title: Roman to Numeral
question:
Challenge:
Convert a given roman number to mathematical number.

title: Remove duplicates from sorted array
question:
Challenge:
Given an integer array nums sorted in non-decreasing order, remove the duplicates in-place such that each unique element appears only once. The relative order of the elements should be kept the same

title: Valid Sudoku
question:
Challenge:
Determine if a 9 x 9 Sudoku board is valid. Only the filled cells need to be validated according to the following rules:
1.Each row must contain the digits 1-9 without repetition.
2.Each column must contain the digits 1-9 without repetition.
3.Each of the nine 3 x 3 sub-boxes of the grid must contain the digits 1-9 without repetition..

title: Spiral Matrix
question:
Challenge:
Output a spiral matrix.

title: Rotate Matrix
question:
Challenge:
Given a (mxn) matrix A , we often need to use another matrix that swaps the rows and columns of A. This action is called the flip of the matrix.

title: Create a Function to print name and age
question:
Challenge:
Create a function that can accept two arguments name and age and print its value.

title: Using Function to take and print value
question:
Challenge:
 Write a function func1() such that it can accept a variable length of  argument and print all arguments value.

title: Assign a different name to function and call it through the new name
question:
Challenge:
Assign a different name to function and call it through the new name.

title: Calculator
question:
Challenge:
Write a function calculation() such that it can accept two variables and calculate the addition and subtraction of them. And also it must return both addition and subtraction in a single return call.

title: Speed of Drivers
question:
Challenge:
Write a function for checking the speed of drivers. This function should have one parameter: speed.

title: Write a function called shownumbers
question:
Challenge:
Write a function called showNumbers that takes a parameter called limit. It should print all the numbers between 0 and limit with a label to identify the even and odd numbers.

title: Print prime numbers.
question:
Challenge:
Write a function that prints all the prime numbers between 0 and limit where limit is a parameter.

title: Print Starts
question:
Challenge:
Write a function called show_stars(rows).

title: Sum of multiples of 3 and 5
question:
Challenge:
Write a function that returns the sum of multiples of 3 and 5 between 0 and limit (parameter).

title: Valid Anagram
question:
Challenge:
Given two strings s and t, return true if t is an anagram of s, and false otherwise.

title: Unique Email Addresses
question:
Challenge:
Every valid email consists of a local name and a domain name, separated by the '@' sign. Besides lowercase letters, the email may contain one or more '.' or '+'.Check if the email is valid or not

title: Excel Sheet Column Title
question:
Challenge:
Given an integer columnNumber, return its corresponding column title as it appears in an Excel sheet.

title: Add Binary
question:
Challenge:
Given two binary strings a and b, return their sum as a binary string.

title: Bulls and Cows
question:
Challenge:
You write down a secret number and ask your friend to guess what the number is. When your friend makes a guess, you provide a hint with the following info:
The number of 'bulls', which are digits in the guess that are in the correct position.
The number of 'cows', which are digits in the guess that are in your secret number but are located in the wrong position. Specifically, the non-bull digits in the guess that could be rearranged such that they become bulls.
Given the secret number secret and your friend's guess guess, return the hint for your friend's guess.
The hint should be formatted as 'xAyB', where x is the number of bulls and y is the number of cows. Note that both secret and guess may contain duplicate digits.

title: Word Search
question:
Challenge:
Given an m x n board of characters and a list of strings words, return all words on the board.
Each word must be constructed from letters of sequentially adjacent cells, where adjacent cells are horizontally or vertically neighboring. The same letter cell may not be used more than once in a word.

title: Reverse String
question:
Challenge:
Write a function that reverses a string. The input string is given as an array of characters s.

title: Search Insert Position
question:
Challenge:
Given a sorted array of distinct integers and a target value, return the index if the target is found. If not, return the index where it would be if it were inserted in order.

title: Merge 2 sorted arrays
question:
Challenge:
You are given two integer arrays nums1 and nums2, sorted in non-decreasing order, and two integers m and n, representing the number of elements in nums1 and nums2 respectively.

title: Sort List
question:
Challenge:
Given the head of a linked list, return the list after sorting it in ascending order.

title: Sort a sentence
question:
Challenge:
A sentence is a list of words that are separated by a single space with no leading or trailing spaces. Each word consists of lowercase and uppercase English letters.
A sentence can be shuffled by appending the 1-indexed word position to each word then rearranging the words in the sentence.

title: Sort squared list
question:
Challenge:
Given an m x n board of characters and a list of strings words, return all words on the board.
Each word must be constructed from letters of sequentially adjacent cells, where adjacent cells are horizontally or vertically neighboring. The same letter cell may not be used more than once in a word.

title: Sort by frequency
question:
Challenge:
Given an array of integers nums, sort the array in increasing order based on the frequency of the values. If multiple values have the same frequency, sort them in decreasing order.
Return the sorted array.

title: Sort integer by number if 1 bits
question:
Challenge:
Given an integer array arr. You have to sort the integers in the array in ascending order by the number of 1's in their binary representation and in case of two or more integers have the same number of 1's you have to sort them in ascending order.

title: Merge strings alternately
question:
Challenge:
You are given two strings word1 and word2. Merge the strings by adding letters in alternating order, starting with word1. If a string is longer than the other, append the additional letters onto the end of the merged string.

title: Search by prefix
question:
Challenge:
Check If a Word Occurs As a Prefix of Any Word in a Sentence.

title: Recursive Sum
question:
Challenge:
Write a recursive function to calculate the sum of numbers from 0 to 10

title: Fibonacci Numbers
question:
Challenge:
Write a recursive function to calculate fibonacci numbers.

title: Ackermann Function
question:
Challenge:
Write a recursive function to calculate the ackermann function.

title: File Output
question:
Challenge:
Write some text and output it into a text file.

title: File Input
question:
Challenge:
Load a text file and print out the contents.
